snippet: State insurance regulators and the Obama administration plan to revise standards so consumers will encounter fewer unexpected out-of-network bills.
abstract: Obama administration and insurance regulators are revising standards to address concerns among consumers who have encountered unexpectedly high out-of-network bills through plans offered under the Affordable Care Act; new measures would impose stricter standards on insurers who unduly limit choices of doctors and hospitals.
lead_paragraph: State insurance regulators and the Obama administration plan to revise standards so consumers will encounter fewer unexpected out-of-network bills.

headline.main: To Prevent Surprise Bills, New Health Law Rules Could Widen Insurer Networks
headline.print_headline: To Prevent Surprise Bills, New Health Law Rules Could Widen Insurer Networks

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
